intro: Astragalus potosinus, commonly known as the Potosí milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or violet flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or arid soils. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
